Part 3 Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom, where the top is slightly wider than the bottom and the object is symmetrical along its central axis. 1. Perform the boolean operations specified in the "operation" properties for each part to combine them into the final shape.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Tapered Middle Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Line 2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.5]. 3. Line 3: Starting at [0.75, 0.5] and ending at [0.0, 0.5]. 4. Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.5] and ending at [0.0, 0.0]. This rectangle represents the base of the prism. Add four circles to this sketch, each with a radius of 0.0125 and positioned as follows: 1. Circle 1: Center at [0.025, 0.025]. 2. Circle 2: Center at [0.025, 0.475]. 3. Circle 3: Center at [0.725, 0.025]. 4. Circle 4: Center at [0.725, 0.475]. Each circle should lie on one of the four corners of the rectangle. Extruding the sketch With the sketch complete, extrude it to create the prism. Set the depth towards the normal direction to 0.025 and the depth opposite the normal direction to 0.0. Apply a sketch scale of 0.75. As described by the "operation" parameter in the JSON data, this extrusion results in a new solid body for the CAD model. The resulting prism has the following dimensions: 1. Length: 0.75 2. Width: 0.75 3. Height: 0.025 This part is complete. Continue to the next part if additional parts are provided in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>
